column3: text1
These small drones serve as the escorts for the Planck-class patrol craft. Their built-in point defense beams make short work of incoming missiles and other threats.

The Planck-class patrol craft serves as an extremely cheap and fast scouting platform. Escorted by a squadron of Worce drones, this vessel is easily able to weave in and out of enemy formations. These ships are just barely too big to be manufactured by fighter autoforges on carriers. As a result, their hyperspace travel is extremely limited without a supporting fleet to carry extra fuel.

This large frigate is the result of the COPS attempting to invent an equivalent to the Brawler-class. Most of the Carbon's design is based heavily on its 'bigger sister', the Bosana-class Destroyer. It sacrifices the explosive mobility of its sibling for a more weapon-centric ship system, routing most of its powergrid to sustain this.

After the success of the Medusa-class, many top engineers in the COPS sought to make an effective, more producible competitor. The result of this was the Bosana-class destroyer. Fast, mobile, and with discrete (versatile) side-mounted turret slots - this vessel certainly fulfills its desired purpose.

This is the more common stock-version of the Bosana-class destroyer, based on its earlier prototypes. It has less flexible mounting points, but it's slightly cheaper to maintain and produce. Many factions across the sector have begun to employ this alternative to the Medusa-class.

The veritable 'riot shield' of the COPS doctrine, Neutroyte-class defense destroyers are prolific in anti-piracy conduct. The vessel sports a disembodied armored module which hovers at its bow. That, along with a nearly impenetrable frontal shield, makes the Neutroyte-class a massive, if slow, presence on the battlefield relative to its size. It sacrifices most of the firepower potential for its rather over-sized power generator to achieve this pinnacle of defense, and its flanks are particularly vulnerable.

This vessel is a true bastardization of the original Neutroyte-class design. Almost all of its power has been rerouted from its former heavy defenses into a large array of jurry-rigged weapon mounts and extra-powerful engines. This leaves it fulfilling the opposite role from its original blueprint, becoming a sort of 'glass-cannon'. Are there no limits to the madness of pirate engineering?
A powerful missile platform designed to be used in tandom with other producers-of-ordnance. The Gluoni-class strikes hard and fast, though it’s a bit flimsy.

The massive Gravon-class heavy cruiser is sometimes (confusingly) referred to as a ‘light battlecruiser’. Its forward ‘Arsenal Module’ supports a myriad of weapons which cannot be disabled by EMP or other means from the front. Once destroyed, however, the weak engine module is almost defenseless. Maintenance costs to deploy and support this ship offset its powerful position in the cruiser size-category.

This vessel is used as the standard attack frigate within the COPS doctrine. While the Muonay-class has somewhat reduced strike capabilities compared to other frigates, its large amount of small weapon mounts allows for it to fill a plethora of roles.

The experimental Tau-class frigate is a testament to the recent advances in phase technology. It’s able to temporarily phase cloak in short, powerful busts, while still maintaining a stable shield generator.

In a sort-of controversial move, the COPS have retrofitted phasing technology to the infamous Tempest-class. Its damage output has suffered, but it has gained a deadly new ability to slow down its prey with relativistic effects.
The Proteus-class light carrier is common in COPS fleets across the sector. Its solid fighter deployment capabilities is supplemented by its impressive speed for a carrier.

The missile capabilities of the Antyma-class is rivaled only by the Gryphon-class. As one might guess, the former was recently designed as a competitor to the latter. Field tests are uncertain to the success of this undertaking, but a wholly original design is still an impressive feat to achieve in this post-collapse society.
A captured (and mostly destroyed) Antyma-class cruiser has been converted by a starry-eyed pirate engineer into a fast-attack platform.
A powerful carrier and example of top COPS engineering. The Electras-class is able to project built-up flux onto enemy targets, forcing their systems to vent for the Electras.
Atome is a name feared by many a pirate lord. Rightfully so, the Atome-class battlecarrier swarms its targets with an onslaught of fighters and bombers while its twin primary weapons open fire.
The Asimov-class battleship is infamous for its twin rows of four large energy slots. It’s slow, lumbering, and has trouble defending itself from angles off its broadsides.
This Wolf-class refit sacrifices some loadout flexibility for a medium missile slot. Its strike capabilities are almost unmatched in the sector.
Atome is a name feared by many a pirate lord. Rightfully so, the Atome-class battlecarrier swarms its targets with an onslaught of fighters and bombers while its twin primary weapons open fire.

The Photoal-class supports a swarm of small drones. It is a powerful escort platform and point defense vessel. While slightly uncommon to see outside of light patrols, it is still quite the powerful vessel for its size.

The advanced autoforge systems found in the Rhodan-class drone carrier allow for its unique escort drone to be modularly modified. This lets the Rhodan fit a huge variety of roles through its sheer flexibility.

This lumbering giant contains enough firepower to blow apart large asteroids. The Mesonax’s missiles are completely unmatched, though do to its nature it has trouble in prolonged front-line engagements. Its long-ranged Comet Storm missiles grant plenty of problems for the enemy fleet to deal with even on their own.

The sturdy Valence-class is more combat than freighter. It sports a surprising amount of firepower, though its civilian-grade power generators struggle to maintain this. The COPS use this vessel quite frequently in the depths of pirate territory to transport supplies and other commodities between outposts.

In order to support the destruction of pirate bases, the COPS needed a dedicated siege platform. The Haydron-class sports a long-ranged weapon of devastating kinetic power, capable of quickly overwhelming the weak shielding systems of pirate stations and capital ships from afar, allowing for the rest of its fleet to move in for the kill. It also finds use as a heavy escort vessel in deep-space thanks to its safety in engagements. Its main weakness is its relative flimsiness, and anything able to close the distance poses a substantial threat to the Haydron-class.

Nicknamed ‘Ghost’ by some, the Quantum-class heavy phase frigate has a special weapon which gathers energy from excess power generated by its phase coils. This energy is heavily affected by phase space and is unstable in nature.
The Lepton-class cruiser sports a large amount of versatility and utility. It is a solid choice for fringe exploration fleets or patrols deep within pirate territory.

The Schala-class patrol craft is fast, effective, and cheap. Its agility is something to admire, and it supports impressive strike capabilities in a pinch. These ships are just barely too big to be manufactured by fighter autoforges on carriers. As a result, their hyperspace travel is extremely limited without a supporting fleet to carry extra fuel.

An analog to the Sunder, the Chrone-class was designed to deliver punishing firepower via its forward large energy mount. It’s fast - if fragile - for a destroyer, and its advance defensive systems somewhat help to protect it.
A great alternative to the Pulse Laser, the Dual Pulse Gun is a larger variety of the Light Pulse Gun.
This weapon was designed with many of the same philosophies as the much larger Autopulse Laser. It forgoes some of the sheer firepower for more sustained damage.

This devastating built-in missile launcher fires in two stages. The missiles can travel extreme distances to reach a target, and once in range they split into several smaller missiles to deliver a barrage of thermal-based attacks.
This unique heavy drone can be customized with a myriad of modular loadouts.
This particle streamer fires short busts of plasma-state positive hydrogen ions at a target. This stream has trouble penetrating defenses, but is absolutely devastating against unarmored targets.
This particle streamer fires short busts of plasma-state positive hydrogen ions at a target. This stream has trouble penetrating defenses, but is absolutely devastating against unarmored targets.
This particle streamer fires short busts of plasma-state positive hydrogen ions at a target. This stream has trouble penetrating defenses, but is absolutely devastating against unarmored targets.

The main spinal weapon of the Haydron-class accelerates projectiles to an extremely high velocity. It utilizes several methods in stages to achieve this effect, including magnetic rails and artificial gravity accelerators.

While the Quantum-class is within Phase Space, this weapon gathers excess energy generated by its phase coils. This energy can be expelled by firing the weapon, drastically increasing its firepower until the energy is expended.

A high-powered weapon which scatters a slew of unstable antimatter and charged particles. It is a powerful tool for those rare ships which have the flux capacity to handle it. It can function quite well as a fighter and missile screening option.
This weapon generates an egregious amount of flux. Spraying a mass of antimatter at its targets, it is capable of wiping out entire fighter squadrons and shredding the armor of smaller craft.
Qark drones are great at several roles, but excel at screening for fighters.
Vents flux utilizing an enemy target. Generates flux on the enemy.
column5: Vents flux utilizing an enemy target. Generates flux on the enemy.
column47:
Temporarily increases the damage taken by the target ship. Generates a significant amount of flux when used.

The duration of the effect is in the reference frame of the source ship; if it phases or otherwise experiences an altered time rate, the duration of the effect will be likewise affected for outside observers.

column3: Speeds up time for the ship and all of its fighters..
column5: Speeds up time for the ship and all of its fighters..

column3: This gigantic station serves as the main base of operations for the COPS. Its special security protocols and thorough screening mean that trading contraband is virtually impossible, so it houses no working black market. Surrounding it is a shroud-like nebula which it uses as both cover and a source of resources. A smaller, collector station orbits it which acts as a siphon.

This gigantic station once served as the main base of operations for the COPS. Without their presence, a black market has finally taken hold. Surrounding it is a shroud-like nebula which it uses as both cover and a source of resources. A smaller, collector station orbits it which acts as a siphon.
This specialized facility collects and processes gasses from the nearby nebula. It utilizes eight smaller siphons which filter out undesirable materials, and concentrates more precious volatiles.
One of the eight siphons used by the Nebula Siphon Station.

The Concordance of Protection Syndicate (COPS) is a joint effort by some defector scientists from within Tritachyon and a group of formerly retired Hegemony officers to create an effective pirate-hunting doctrine. They have deep ties with the Hegemony, but aren't technically under their jurisdiction. They were initially funded by both the Hegemony and a small sect from the Luddic Church, but have quickly gained the favor of most non-pirate organizations within the sector. A notable exception to this is the Syndrian Diktat, who as usual hate the idea of some unified policing state.

Their tech, while advanced, lacks regulations and a proper nanoforge. On top of this, production is rushed to combat pirate raids and encampments. As such, many of their ships come off the line with several defects and damage.
